info.title: Xero OAuth 2 Identity Service API
info.description: These endpoints are related to managing authentication tokens and identity for Xero API. IMPORTANT: Xero's OAuth flow requires two steps: (1) User authorizes your app (OAuth token obtained), (2) User must explicitly select which Xero organisation (tenant) to connect. Client ID and client secret do NOT automatically bind a tenant. After authorization, use GET /Connections to retrieve the tenantId(s) that the user connected. Without a tenant connection, you'll have a valid OAuth token but Accounting API calls will return 403 errors.

get.description: Retrieves the connections (tenant bindings) for the authenticated user. A Connection represents a link between your app and a Xero organisation (tenant) that was authorized by the user. After OAuth authorization, users must explicitly select which tenant(s) to connect. This endpoint returns all connected tenants for the current user. Use the tenantId from the Connection objects as the xero-tenant-id header value when making Accounting API requests. If this returns an empty array, no tenants are connected and Accounting API calls will fail with 403 errors.
get.summary: Retrieves the connections for this user

200.description: Success - return response of type Connections array with 0 to n Connection

delete.description: Override the base server url that include version
delete.summary: Deletes a connection for this user (i.e. disconnect a tenant)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for retrieving single object

204.description: Success - connection has been deleted no content returned

authEventId.description: Identifier shared across connections authorised at the same time

createdDateUtc.description: The date when the user connected this tenant to your app

updatedDateUtc.description: The date when the user most recently connected this tenant to your app. May differ to the created date if the user has disconnected and subsequently reconnected this tenant to your app.

refresh_token.description: refresh token provided during authentication flow

access_token.description: access token provided during authentication flow

expires_in.description: time in seconds until access token expires.

refresh_token.description: token used to refresh an expired access token

OAuth2.description: Xero uses a two-step OAuth flow: (1) User authorizes your app and grants permissions, (2) User must explicitly select which Xero organisation (tenant) to connect. Client ID and client secret alone do NOT bind a tenant. After authorization, call GET /Connections to retrieve connected tenants. Without a tenant connection, you'll have a valid OAuth token but Accounting API calls will return 403 errors.

scopes.offline_access: Core OAuth requirement for obtaining refresh tokens. Required for long-lived access but may not appear in standard API permission checkbox lists as it's categorized as a core OAuth requirement rather than a data-specific permission.
scopes.email: Grant read-only access to your email
scopes.openid: Grant read-only access to your open id
